DOC.brief_title: Efficacy Dietary Supplementation With Lactobacilllus Reuteri DSM 17938 Functional Abdominal Pain ( FAP ) Children
DOC.detailed_description: This randomize , double-blind , placebo-controlled study . Subjects 5-16 year age FAP define Rome III criterion pain severity least 40 mm 100 mm VAS scale pain frequency least 1 episode per week precede 8 week recruit . In accordance specific Rome III criterion inclusion , FAP define variable combination chronic recurrent gastrointestinal symptom explain structural biochemical abnormality . A study questionnaire record pain gastrointestinal symptom use . One-hundred six ( 106 ) Subjects randomize receive either dietary supplementation L. reuteri DSM 17938 ( 2 chewable tablet breakfast ) , number comparable placebo tablet , 4 week . Supplementation stop 4 week , subject follow additional 4 week . The subject complete diary record frequency intensity pain , use medication , deviation usual diet , physical activity , absence school activity . Gastrointestinal symptom assess GSRS ( Gastrointestinal Symptom Rating Score ) . Subjects/caregivers instruct maintain usual diet throughout study , consume probiotic ( food supplement ) entire study period . The symptom diary complete daily parent report information frequency pain episode , location pain , presence absence associate symptom , need take medication pain interference normal activity . The intensity symptom assess use Wong-Baker Faces scale .
